name: PushPriceList_Async
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `Pricing:Manage`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

request_samples.name: JSON
request_samples.sample:
{
  "ActiveForOrganizationUnits": [
    {
      "Delete": true,
      "OrganizationUnitID": "string",
      "PricingGroupID": "string",
      "TargetOrganizationUnitID": "string",
      "UsageType": 1
    }
  ],
  "Components": [
    {
      "CopyPricesFromOtherPriceListData": {
        "ExcludeProductsInFilter": true,
        "PriceListID": "string",
        "ProductSearchTemplateID": 123
      },
      "Delete": true,
      "EndDate": "2024-11-29",
      "ID": "string",
      "Label": "string",
      "MarkupData": {
        "ExcludeProductsInFilter": true,
        "FactorValue": 123.456,
        "ProductSearchTemplateID": 123,
        "Type": 1
      },
      "Name": "string",
      "OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice": true,
      "PriceEntriesData": {
        "BlobID": "909121b0-f272-4dd7-87ca-6482aeaf4e9a",
        "Prices": [
          {
            "EndDate": "2024-11-29",
            "ID": "string",
            "Price": 123.456,
            "ProductID": "string",
            "StartDate": "2024-11-29"
          }
        ]
      },
      "PricingGroupID": "string",
      "SequenceNumber": 123,
      "StartDate": "2024-11-29",
      "Type": 2
    }
  ],
  "CurrencyID": "string",
  "ID": "string",
  "IsActive": true,
  "LowProductCountOption": 2,
  "Name": "string",
  "RecalculateEffectivePrices": true,
  "SpecifiedPricesIncludeTax": true,
  "SystemID": "string",
  "TimeZone": "string",
  "WaitForCompletion": true
}

request_samples.name: CURL
request_samples.sample:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "EVA-User-Agent: MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
  --data '{
  "ActiveForOrganizationUnits": [
    {
      "Delete": true,
      "OrganizationUnitID": "string",
      "PricingGroupID": "string",
      "TargetOrganizationUnitID": "string",
      "UsageType": 1
    }
  ],
  "Components": [
    {
      "CopyPricesFromOtherPriceListData": {
        "ExcludeProductsInFilter": true,
        "PriceListID": "string",
        "ProductSearchTemplateID": 123
      },
      "Delete": true,
      "EndDate": "2024-11-29",
      "ID": "string",
      "Label": "string",
      "MarkupData": {
        "ExcludeProductsInFilter": true,
        "FactorValue": 123.456,
        "ProductSearchTemplateID": 123,
        "Type": 1
      },
      "Name": "string",
      "OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice": true,
      "PriceEntriesData": {
        "BlobID": "909121b0-f272-4dd7-87ca-6482aeaf4e9a",
        "Prices": [
          {
            "EndDate": "2024-11-29",
            "ID": "string",
            "Price": 123.456,
            "ProductID": "string",
            "StartDate": "2024-11-29"
          }
        ]
      },
      "PricingGroupID": "string",
      "SequenceNumber": 123,
      "StartDate": "2024-11-29",
      "Type": 2
    }
  ],
  "CurrencyID": "string",
  "ID": "string",
  "IsActive": true,
  "LowProductCountOption": 2,
  "Name": "string",
  "RecalculateEffectivePrices": true,
  "SpecifiedPricesIncludeTax": true,
  "SystemID": "string",
  "TimeZone": "string",
  "WaitForCompletion": true
}' \
  https://euw.acme.test.eva-online.cloud/message/PushPriceList_Async

C.name: PricingGroupID
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: TargetOrganizationUnitID
C.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

C.name: UsageType
C.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - Sales
* `1` - Cost
* `2` - Promotion
* `3` - Purchase
* `4` - RecommendedRetail
* `5` - PotentialDiscountedPrice
* `6` - EcoTax

E.name: ExcludeProductsInFilter
E.description: If true, all products except the matching ones will have their prices copied. If false, only the matching ones will have their prices copied.

E.name: PriceListID
E.description: The ID of the pricelist to copy prices from.

E.name: ProductSearchTemplateID
E.description:
The ID of the ProductSearchTemplate to use to filter the products to copy. If left empty all products will be copied.

This is the ID of a `ProductSearchTemplate`

F.name: ExcludeProductsInFilter
F.description: If true, all products except the matching ones will have their prices copied. If false, only the matching ones will have their prices copied.

F.name: FactorValue
F.description:
The value of the markup/markdown. If Type is Amount, this is the amount to add to the price.
If Type is Percentage, this is the amount that the Price will be multiplied by.

A 10% markup should be specified as 1.10, a 25% discount should be specified as 0.75.

F.name: ProductSearchTemplateID
F.description:
The ID of the ProductSearchTemplate to use to filter the products to copy. If left empty all products will be copied.

This is the ID of a `ProductSearchTemplate`

F.name: Type
F.description:
The type of markup/markdown. Either absolute amount or a percentage. Determines how FactorValue will be interpreted.
Possible values:

* `0` - Amount
* `1` - Percentage

G.name: BlobID
Prices
G.description: The inline data that will be used to create the price entries. If left empty the blob will be used.

D.name: CopyPricesFromOtherPriceListData
D.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = PricesFromOtherPriceList which is a component to copy prices from another pricelist.

Is useful for example for promotion prices, where you first 'import' the prices from the original pricelist, and then apply a negative markup to them to create a promotion discount.

Which prices you copy can be modified by specifying a ProductSearchTemplateID, only products that are contained in the results of the search will be copied,
unless ExcludeProductsInFilter is set to true, in which case the reverse is true; all products except the matching ones will have their prices copied.

D.name: Delete
D.description: If specified as true, the component will be deleted.

D.name: EndDate
D.description:
Determines when this component will become inactive. After this date the component will not be included in the calculation of the pricelist.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: ID
D.description: The unique identifier for this component. Required.

D.name: Label
D.description: Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: MarkupData
D.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = Markup which is a component that alters the price value of the previusly applied components,
either up or down. The markup/markdown can either be an absolute value or a percentage depending on the Type.

D.name: Name
D.description:
The name of the component. If left empty on creation of the component the ID will be used as the name.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice
D.description:
Determines if the price resulting from this component simply replaces the value as calculated by preceding components or if it's a relative value.

It defaults to false.

This affects the different component types in the following ways:

PriceEntries:

If OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice = true then the value of the price entry replaces any value by a previous component. If false (the default) then the price entry is added to the existing value.

So if a previous component calculated that the price should be 100 and there is a price entry for 90, then with OverrideCurrentCalculatedPrice = true the resulting price will become 90. With false, it would become 190.

Markup:

It's only applied to a markup component if it has Type = Amount, it does not have any effect for Type = Percentage.

If set to true, a Amount markup component will function like a price entry compnent and replace the current value with the amount of the markup component.

If false (the default) it will add the Amount of the markup component to the current calculated value.

D.name: PriceEntriesData
D.description:
The data that accompanies a Component with Type = PriceEntries, so a component that is simply a list of product/price pairs.
The simplest and most direct way to give a product a price.

This data consists of either a list of product/price pairs or a BlobID which is a reference to a previously created blob in EVA that contains data of the following format:

[
    {
      "ProductID": "<ProductID>",
      "Price": <Price>
    },
    ...
]

If you only supply a handful of prices, the inline data works well, but for large quantities of prices you may want to use the BlobID method.

This data is ignored for all other Component types.

PriceEntries data is processed asynchronously in the background and will not be immediately visible after the service call returns.

D.name: PricingGroupID
D.description:
The PricingGroupID that this component is active for. Components with a PricingGroupID are only active for users that are members of that group. If left empty the component will be active for all users.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

D.name: SequenceNumber
D.description: Components are applied in the order of their sequence number, from lowest to highest.

D.name: StartDate
D.description: Determines when this component will become active. Until then the component will not be included in the calculation of the pricelist.

D.name: Type
D.description:
Determines the type of the component. Cannot be changed after creation.
Possible values:

* `0` - PriceEntries
* `1` - Markup
* `2` - CopyPricesFromOtherPriceList

B.name: ActiveForOrganizationUnits
B.description: The organization units that use this pricelist. If left empty will leave the current configuration unchanged. If specified, will replace the current configuration.

B.name: Components
B.description: The list of components that make up the pricelist. If left empty this will leave the current configuration unchanged. If specified only the components present will be modified. Components must be explictly deleted.

B.name: CurrencyID
B.description: The currency for the pricelist. Must be present for the creation of a pricelist but can be left empty in subsequent calls.

B.name: ID
B.description:
The unique identifier for this pricelist.

This string must be between 1 (incl) and 255 (incl) characters long.

B.name: IsActive
B.description: Whether or not the pricelist is active.

B.name: LowProductCountOption
B.description:
The PushPriceList service is optimized for updating a pricelist in its entirety, so for many products at once when using a PriceEntry component. When using few products or even single products this service can perform unnecessary work. It's always recommended to
use this service in a large batch manner but if that's not possible you can specify your intent by using either LowProductCountOption = Auto or Optimize. Effectively this service will simply store the new price entries and return.
The updated prices won't become effective until the next calculation round, which happens every 15 minutes. The threshold for 'low product count' is set at 100 products.
Possible values:

* `0` - Auto
* `1` - Optimize
* `2` - DoNotOptimize

B.name: Name
B.description:
The name of the pricelist. Must be present for the creation of a pricelist but can be left empty in subsequent calls.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: RecalculateEffectivePrices
B.description:
Whether or not to immediately recalculate the effective prices after processing the changes. Otherwise, the prices are automatically recalculated every 15 minutes. Until such a recalculation has been performed, the old price will remain active.
Defaults to false, only specify as true if you cannot wait for the normal recalculation cycle.

B.name: SpecifiedPricesIncludeTax
B.description:
If set to true then all prices specified on this price list will be interpreted as already VAT-included. If set to false then all prices will be interpreted as VAT-excluded. If not specified then the default value is true.

So if a price entry of 90 EUR is added to this pricelist with SpecifiedPricesIncludeTax = true (or not specified) then the price will be interpreted as 90 EUR already including VAT.
If SpecifiedPricesIncludeTax = false then the price will be interpreted as 90 EUR excluding VAT so that will be added on top for any orders created with this price.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: SystemID
B.description:
A string that identifies the system that was used to call this service. In combination with the ID of the pricelist, this is what uniquely identifies the pricelist in EVA.
The SystemID must be the same for every call, if it's different from a previous call then a new pricelist will be created.

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 50 (incl) characters long.

B.name: TimeZone
B.description:
The timezone that will be used to interpret activation times for prices.

Providing a `null` value and not providing the property at all has different meanings.

B.name: WaitForCompletion
B.description: If specified as true, the call to PushPriceList will not return until all uploaded prices have been stored and all prices have been recalculated. Normally this process runs in the background.

J.name: Code
J.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

J.name: Message
J.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

J.name: RequestID
J.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

J.name: Type
J.description: A short description of the error type.

K.name: ExternalIDs
K.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

K.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
K.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

K.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
K.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
